rules: Rule1: If the show has funding for the facility, then the facility is open.
Rule2: Under the condition that an animal is sick, that animal is not quarantined.
Rule3: Provided that an animal is diagnosed by a veterinarian, if that animal is sick, then it is quarantined.
Rule4: Either the animal is diagnosed by a veterinarian or the animal is observed by a caretaker.
Rule5: In case the animal is observed by a caretaker, then if the animal is sick, it is quarantined.
Rule6: If the animal's enclosure is clean, then either the facility undergoes routine maintenance or, under the condition that the facility is not open, it has emergency supplies.
Rule7: Given that the animal has a scheduled cleaning, if the enclosure is not clean, then it is not dirty.
Rule8: The animal has a scheduled cleaning or the animal has a special cleaning.
Rule9: Whenever the animal has a special cleaning, then if the enclosure is not clean, it is not dirty.
Rule10: Under the condition that the facility has a working generator, it has a backup generator.
Rule11: If the facility experiences a power outage, then should the facility not be open, it has a working generator.
Rule12: Provided that the facility has an electrical fault, the lights are not on.
Rule13: Either the facility has an electrical fault or the facility has storm damage.
Rule14: Under the condition that the facility has storm damage, there is a flooded area.
Rule15: Whenever the facility has a flooded area, the lights are not on.
Rule16: If the animal is healthy, then the facility is operational.
Rule17: Either the animal receives medical treatment or, if the person has a caretaker for the animal, then the animal is healthy.
Rule18: Provided that the animal has recovered, it does not receive medical treatment.
Rule19: Under the condition that the animal is in stable condition, it does not receive medical treatment.
Rule20: If the show is an adoption event, then either the animal has recovered or the animal is in stable condition.
Rule21: Provided that the event is rescheduled, the show is at the same location.
Rule22: Under the condition that the show has a new date, the event is not canceled.
Rule23: Whenever the show is at the same location, it has a new date.
Rule24: Given that the animal has a scheduled appointment, it has a veterinarian visit.
Rule25: Either the animal has a scheduled appointment or the animal is a walk-in.
Rule26: In case the animal is a walk-in, then if the animal is vaccinated, the facility is operational.
Rule27: If the person has completed paperwork for the animal, then provided that the animal is microchipped, the facility is operational.
Rule28: Whenever the adoption of the animal by the person is pending, it is approved.
Rule29: If the facility is understaffed, then it is not overcrowded.
Rule30: Provided that the facility is operational, it is open.
Rule31: Under the condition that the animal has a veterinarian at the facility, the facility is operational.
Rule32: Either the animal has a veterinarian at the facility or the person has a caretaker for the animal.
Rule33: Whenever the person has a caretaker for the animal, the animal is vaccinated.
Rule34: Given that the person has a caretaker for the animal, the animal is microchipped.
Rule35: If it is not the case that either the facility has donations or, if the show does not have funding for the facility, then the facility has volunteers, then the facility is overcrowded.
Rule36: Whenever it is not the case that if the person has a caretaker for the animal then the facility is operational, the animal is sick.

Rule37: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the facility has donations or, if the show does not have funding for the facility, then the facility has volunteers, then the facility is understaffed, the facility is closing.

Rule38: If it is not the case that under the condition that it is not the case that either the facility has donations or, if the show does not have funding for the facility, then the facility has volunteers, the facility is understaffed, then the facility is not closing.
Rule39: If the show does not have funding for the facility, then the facility does not have volunteers.
Rule40: Provided that the animal's enclosure is not clean, it is dirty.
Rule41: If the facility does not experience a power outage, then the lights are on.
Rule42: Under the condition that the show is not an adoption event, the event is canceled.
Rule43: Provided that the show is not an adoption event, the event is rescheduled.
Rule44: Given that the person has not completed paperwork for the animal, the adoption of the animal by the person is pending.
Rule45: Whenever the facility is not open, it does not have emergency supplies.
Rule46: If the facility is not open, then it does not have a backup generator.
facts: Fact1: The facility does not undergo routine maintenance.
Fact2: The facility does not have donations.
Fact3: The animal does not have a veterinarian visit.
Fact4: The adoption of the animal by the person is not approved.
